DENTAL WORLD CENTER INC reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
Technology; The Diversity Among RAM's
description: THE random access memory chip, or RAM, has always been the biggest seller because it is such a standard product. Storing of data is common to all computers, and the same RAM's have been used both in giant mainframe computers and in tiny desktop ones. Moreover, one manufacturer's RAM has been interchangeable with another's. Japanese companies hold about about two-thirds of the world market for the current generation of memory chip, the 64K RAM, and some American companies have had to drop out.

title: FIRST OHIO BANCSHARES reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: The per share earnings were restated for 50 percent stock dividend paid in May.

title: BRIEFING
description: Help From Mrs. Onassis

title: Excerpts from statement, page D19.
description: Paul A. Volcker, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that the board had raised the limit on the growth of the money supply for the rest of the year.

title: JOSLYN MANUFACTURING & SUPPLY CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Nassau Drivers Get an Extension
description: Nassau County residents have been given an eight-day grace period to renew their auto registrations and driver's licenses because of a fire in the state's Motor Vehicle Bureau here.

title: Cap the Complacent
description: The Navy has confessed to Congress that it's been paying $110 for diodes that should have cost 4 cents. That's not 20 times the right price, or even 200 times, but 2,750 times.

title: ALBERTO-CULVER CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Wisconsin Radioactive Spill
description: About 15,000 gallons of radioactive water sprayed onto the floor of a containment building at the nuclear plant here after a gasket failed over the weekend, it was disclosed today. Jan Strasma of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission in Chicago said there was no danger to the public or the plant. The reactor was shut immediately and will probably be closed all week.

title: GF CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: GF Corp. was formerly GF Business Equipment Inc.

title: CAR ACCIDENT PROTECTION: 'AIRBAGS ARE THE BEST POSSIBLE MEANS'
description: To the Editor:

title: KNIGHT-RIDDER NEWSPAPERS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
THURSDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Yankees vs. Kansas City Royals, at Yankee Stadium, 8 P.M. Gaylord Perry, whose most recent victory over the Yankees came last year and marked the 300th triumph of his career, is nearing another milestone. When the 44-year-old right-hander goes to the mound tonight, he will need only 14 strikeouts to pass Walter Johnson and move into third place on the major leagues' career list. (Television - Channel 11, 8 P.M. Radio - WABC, 770; 8 P.M.) Mets vs. Reds, at Cincinnati. The Mets, last in the East, open a four-game series with the Reds, last in the West. (Television - SportsChannel, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WHN, 1050; 7:30 P.M.) Boxing Tyrone Crawley vs. Tom Baker, lightweights, 10 rounds, at Resorts International Hotel and Casino, Atlantic City; first preliminary, 8 P.M. Two members of the Frazier family are on the undercard. Joe Frazier Jr., son of the former heavyweight champion, is in a sixround junior-welterweight bout against Gavin White, and the former champion's nephew, the heavyweight Rodney Frazier, goes against Mel Daniel in another six-rounder. (Television - ESPN, 8:30 P.M.) Other Events Basketball: Michelob New York Pro Summer League games, at Manhattan Community College: Dyckman vs. Pony, 6:15 P.M., and Michelob vs. Con Ed, 8:15 P.M.; N.B.A./Miller Pro-Am League games, at Springfield Gardens (Queens) High School: Pro Keds vs. Courtsmen, 7:15 P.M., and New York Gems vs. Lite Beer, 8:45 P.M. Bicycling: Tour de France, the 19th of 22 legs.

title: PIANIST: DEGAETANO AS GOTTSCHALK
description: IT is said that one needs a gimmick to get ahead in this world, and the pianist Robert DeGaetano has hit upon one that seems cleverer than most. On Tuesday night he began the presentation of three piano recitals at the Barge, a floating concert hall moored in the East River near the foot of the Brooklyn Bridge on the Brooklyn side. For these recitals, he impersonates musical figures of the past in key moments of their careers.

title: CAPITAL CITIES COMMUNICATIONS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CALIFORNIA TOWN THAT TRIED MERIT PAY DROPPED IT AS DIVISIVE
description: A teacher merit pay system of roughly 25 years' standing was abandoned here last fall in what some teachers and school officials described as a period of frustration, resentment and discord.

title: BALDOR ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
DREW NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $1,000 related to reversal of a tax credit. c-Net income including a tax credit of $164,000.

title: ARKANSAS BEST CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Including an extraordinary tax credit of $28,000 for the quarter and 6 months. c-Net loss.

title: DANCE: FESTIVAL PRESENTS YOUNG CHOREOGRAPHERS
description: Thanks to the American Dance Festival's Young Choreographers and Composers in Residence Program, three young composers were able to collaborate this summer with the companies of three young choreographers. The new works that resulted were presented Tuesday night at Reynolds Theater on the Duke University campus, with the chamber ensemble conducted by David Stock in the pit.

title: WASTE MANAGEMENT INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
WEAN UNITED INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
EQUINOX SOLAR INC reports earnings for year to May 31.
AMERICAN TELEPHONE & TELEGRAPH CO INC (AT&T) reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Guinness in the U.S.  To Isidore & Paulson
description: Although in this country, at least, there has been little advertising for Guinness stout or Harp beer, both products of Arthur Guinness & Son, London, that situation could change.

title: 4 Are Acquitted in Italy In Bombing of Train
description: The trial of defendants charged with the 1974 bombing of an Italian train that killed 12 people and injured 47 ended here today with their acquittal for lack of evidence, judicial officials said.

title: JAZZ: SAXOPHONISTS SHARE BILLING
description: WHEN two saxophonists share billing and a bandstand, they usually egg each other on. But just the opposite happened Tuesday as the Hank Crawford-David (Fathead) Newman Quintet began a five-day engagement at Fat Tuesday.

title: AMERICAN CYANAMID CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CONRAIL NET UP DESPITE REVENUE DIP
description: The Consolidated Rail Corporation yesterday reported a 16.7 percent rise in net income to $97.2 million, or $3.66 a share, for the second quarter, from $83.8 million, or $3.31 a share, a year before.

title: Bridge: Hamman and Kantar Win National Life Master Pairs
description: Two of the world's greatest players won the Life Master Pair Championship today in the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals here.

title: VERBATIM CORP reports earnings for qtr to July 1.
description: Share earnings and shares outstanding do not reflect the stock split announced earlier yesterday, but does reflect a 2-for-1 stock split in November 1982.

title: The Homeless Won't Go Away
description: It's out of desperation that New York City has sent 284 homeless families to New Jersey hotels, not ''callousness and irresponsibility,'' as Governor Kean intemperately puts it. New York has long been short of places for the homeless, and last month a court put some more hotels off-limits as too dirty and dangerous for children. Then, as tourists flooded the city, several hotels suddenly stopped taking homeless families.

title: CUTBACKS BY CBS NEWS REPORTED IN COST DRIVE
description: CBS News will lay off 14 employees next week and will begin repeating half of its four-hour overnight ''Nightwatch'' broadcast in an effort to cut costs, sources at CBS news said yesterday.

title: No Headline
description: Required Reading Tennessee's Bounty

title: A FAMILIAR AREA FOR QUAKER OATS
description: For the Quaker Oats Company, the challenge of day-to-day operations can be summarized in a single question: How does one manage a $2.7 billion food empire when one's mainstay customer, the United States breakfast eater, is not eating any more breakfasts?

title: Computer Venture
description: The Mitsubishi Corporation, the International Business Machines Corporation and the Cosmos 80 Company said they had agreed to set up two joint ventures in Japan that would link computers using fiber optics. Under the agreement, one of the companies established by the three partners would develop the software needed for the communications system, and the other would develop both software and hardware. Mitsubishi and I.B.M.'s Japanese unit will each hold 34 percent of the new companies; Cosmo will hold 32 percent.

title: TRANSACT INTERNATIONAL DIVISION OF GRAM INDUSTRIES reports earnings for year to April 30.
description: b-After a loss of $3,705 from discontinued operations, a tax credit of $87,500, and an expense of $200,000 for possible losses arising from litigation. c-After a loss of $121,751 from discontinued operations, a tax credit of $937,710, and a gain of $443,710, or 7 cents a share, resulting from the elimination of deferred income taxes related to the company's export subsidiary.

title: VISUAL ELECTRONICS CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes a tax benefit of $51,000. c-Includes a tax benefit of $92,000.

title: U.S. ASSAY OFFICE SITE SOLD DOWNTOWN FOR $27 MILLION
description: The United States Assay Office in lower Manhattan, the nation's last public gold refinery, was going, going, gone yesterday. The property was sold for $27 million, making it the most valuable piece of Government real estate ever put to public auction.

title: BANK OF VIRGINIA CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
BUNKER HILL INCOME SECURITIES INC reports earnings for As of June 30.
description: Asset figures represent net assets.

title: Move Opposed By 3 Democrats
description: The three votes against censuring Representatives Daniel B. Crane, Republican of Illinois, and Gerry E. Studds, Democrat of Massachusetts, were cast today by Democratic Representatives Mervyn M. Dymally of California, Parren J. Mitchell of Maryland and William Clay of Missouri, in both cases.

title: HAWAIIAN ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: The year-ago 6 months results include a nonrecurring credit of $12,723,000, or $1.77 a share, to reflect an accounting change.

title: GENERAL FOODS CORP reports earnings for qtr to July 2.
MEDIA GENERAL INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
PRAYER AMENDMENT'S IRREPARABLE DEFECTS
description: To the Editor:

title: A CITIZEN-EXPERT TAKES HIS IDEA TO CAPITOL HILL
description: Allen B. Rosenstein headed back to the University of California at Los Angeles today, his black leather briefcase thinned of photocopied statements and reports that he had passed out to policymakers when they were available and to their aides when they were not.

title: Adding ZIP
description: P olice codes grow increasingly familiar to the public: 10-30 for a robbery in progress, 10-31 for a burglary in progress, 10-53 for a vehicle accident. Now the officers are using 2580.

title: Lorrin A. Shepard, Missionary In Turkey Till '57, Dies at 93
description: Dr. Lorrin A. Shepard, a former medical missionary who was director of the American Hospital in Istanbul, Turkey, from 1927 to 1957, died Saturday at the Union Mission Nursing Home in Haverhill, Mass. He was 93 years old.

title: Executives
description: * Andlinger & Co., Tarrytown, N.Y., has elected Paul R. Charron president and chief operating officer of its Brown & Bigelow subsidiary in St. Paul.

title: CONFEREES APPROVE PLAN TO REPEAL WITHHOLDING
description: Congressional conferees broke an impasse tonight and approved a compromise that would repeal withholding of taxes on dividends and interest but still recoup additional revenue through new measures to increase tax compliance.

title: STAGE: 2 ONE-ACT PLAYS
description: TWO talented playwrights, Percy Granger and Leslie Lee, are represented by very slight examples of their work in an evening of one-act plays presented by the American Folk Theater at the Actors and Directors Theater. Both plays would seem better if the productions, staged by Miguel Ten and Robert Maitland, respectively, were sharper.

title: THE RIVER BOATMEN WHO SIT AND WAIT
description: Because of a safety clause in a union contract, a contractor must pay a man $16.37 an hour to sit in a rowboat below a bridge in case a worker falls. The job has proved so boring that several men have given it up.

title: PARSONS CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CITEL INC reports earnings for qtr to July 1.
BALL CORP reports earnings for qtr to July 3.
HOME BEAT
description: THE 12 signs of the Zodiac have been used as the overall theme for the recently opened midsummer model rooms at Gimbels. ''Although I'm not a 100 percent believer in horoscopes I did want to match the decor to what we think are the preferences of people born under certain signs,'' explained Gerda Clark, the store's vice president and home fashions director.

title: ROBERTSHAW CONTROLS CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
POLISH PARLIAMENT BROADENS REGIME'S POWERS
description: The Polish Parliament granted broad new powers to the Government today and acted to extend many martial law curbs for 18 months.

title: CORPORATE AMBIVALENCE ON DAY CARE
description: AS early as 6:30 A.M. each weekday morning Kathy Cannell has already bundled up her 6-month-old daughter, Aileen, and 3-year-old toddler, LaNelle, and is ready to leave home in Hamden, Conn. The baby is dropped off at her parents' house on the other side of town. LaNelle is left at the Stamford Day Care Program, near Mrs. Cannell's office.

title: Bank Aide Sees Rate Damage
description: A World Bank official said today that although some industrialized nations are now pulling out of recession, ''global economic recovery will be a long-term process.''

title: GOODRICH, B F, CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Including a gain of $4.4 million from the sale of a chemical plant and $3.9 million from a subsidy received in connection with an acquisition. c-Net income.

title: Soviet Confirms Arrest Of Greenpeace Group
description: The Soviet Union confirmed today that its soldiers seized six American environmentalists on the Siberian coast. It said the six, members of Greenpeace International, were in good health.

title: NEWPORT PHARMACEUTICALS INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for qtr to April 30.
description: b-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $792,328 for the quarter and $1,000,000 for the year.

title: HARLEM POLICE TRY TO ERASE HARSH IMAGE
description: The streetwise dialogue of the young men socializing on a corner in Harlem, in one of summer's rituals, turned to talk of the police. ''Those cops over there don't care,'' said one particularly animated man, who identified himself only as ''Squeak'' and gestured toward the 28th Precinct station house down Frederick Douglass Boulevard, at 123d Street. ''They'll beat you if you look at them the wrong way, so who needs them?''

title: MAPCO INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes a gain of $3,579,000 from the extinguishment of debt.

title: Ministers of 4 Lands In Central America Offer Own Peace Bid
description: Four Central American nations, declaring that they must ''solve their own problems,'' issued an eight-point peace plan today to reduce strife and the threat of war with Nicaragua through negotiations.

title: MONTGOMERY STREET INCOME SECURITIES INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
The Orient Express To Get a Magazine
description: A type of in-flight magazine for the very well-off with a rate of $7,000 a page to reach 20,000 people? If a $350 cost per thousand is too rich for your blood, read no further.

title: ATHEY PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: The company is listed on the Midwest Stock Exchange.

title: HOUSE CENSURES CRANE AND STUDDS FOR SEXUAL RELATIONS WITH PAGES
description: The House of Representatives today formally censured Representatives Daniel B. Crane, Republican of Illinois, and Gerry E. Studds, Democrat of Massachusetts, after voting overwhelmingly to strengthen the penalities recommended by its ethics committee.

title: CROMPTON & KNOWLES CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 25.
ENGELHARD CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
KISSINGER CALLS PRINTING OF PENTAGON PAPERS PROPER
description: Former Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger has stated that the press did nothing improper by publishing the Pentagon Papers in 1971 although he was ''outraged'' by their appearance in public at the time.

title: UNION PACIFIC CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Year-ago results include a gain of $29,800,000 from the sale of IC Industries common stock, but do not include the earnings of Missouri Pacific Corp. and Western Pacific Railroad Co. which were acquired in December.

title: MULTIBANK FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Hot and Dry Weather Spurs Crop Futures
description: Futures prices of all major agricultural crops soared yesterday as weather forecasters said they saw no end to the hot and dry weather that has been baking the Middle West since the start of the month.

title: MELVILLE CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
ROBINS, A H, CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CENTRAL BANCORP INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
JB'S RESTAURANTS INC reports earnings for qtr to July 3.
Help the I.M.F. - and Ourselves
description: There are three compelling reasons for Congress to vote an $8.4 billion increase in America's contribution to the International Monetary Fund:

title: CASCO-NORTHERN CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
INFORMATICS GENERAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
BALLET: NATALIA MAKAROVA IN 'PROUST'
description: NATALIA MAKAROVA and Richard Cragun made their debuts in Roland Petit's ballet ''Proust - Les Intermittences du Cour'' on Tuesday night at the Metropolitan Opera House with the Ballet National de Marseille. Jean-Pierre Aviotte made a local debut in the major male duet that symbolizes the ballet's final duel between good and evil.

title: Western Electric
description: The Western Electric Company, the manufacturing unit of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, plans to consolidate its distribution and repair operations in seven states this year, affecting about 830 employees. The company said it took a $190 million write-off in the second quarter to cover costs of the plan.

title: Unit of ITT Wins China Contract
description: The ITT Corporation, formerly International Telephone and Telegraph, said one of its Belgian subsidiaries, the Bell Telephone Manufacturing Company, had won a $250 million contract from China for telephone equipment.

title: GENERAL HOMES reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
VULCAN INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes a gain of $266,000 from the sale of assets.

title: OLD STONE CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After reversals of tax credits of $180,000 for the latest quarter and $307,000 for the year-ago period. c-After tax credits of $960,000 for the latest 6 months and $178,000 for the year-earlier period.

title: VIDEO CONNECTION OF AMERICA reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
Federated Stores
description: Federated Department Stores Inc. said in Cincinnati that it had signed letters of intent to sell certain stores now operated by Bullock's North division in the San Francisco Bay area. Federated did not specify how many stores are being sold or to whom. ''Despite the significant progress that has been made by the division, strategic positioning in the marketing area would have required major investments which would have been difficult to consummate and we decided instead to sell the stores,'' a company spokesman said.

title: TELERATE INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CORRECTIONS
description: An item in the Briefing column of the Washington Talk page on May 16 incorrectly identified and quoted a professor who commented on a suggestion that Stanford University's relationship with the Hoover Institution would have been challenged irrespective of the institution's political leanings. The professor, Alphonse Juilland of Stanford, said, ''Whoever believes that belongs in Disneyland.''

title: MINNESOTA MINING TO CLEAN UP WASTE DUMP
description: The Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Company has announced plans to spend more than $6 million to clean up three abandoned dumps here that environmental officials say have contaminated ground water and soil with hazardous chemical wastes.

title: MERCHANTS NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Quotation of the Day
description: ''Resolved, one, that Representative Daniel B. Crane be censured; two, that Representative Daniel B. Crane present himself in the well of the House for the pronouncement of censure; and three, that Representative Daniel B. Crane be censured with the public reading of this resolution by the Speaker.'' - Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., who later read an identical resolution citing Representative Gerry E. Studds. (A1:4.)

title: CUTLER-FEDERAL INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Net loss.

title: Maryland Rejects Food Aid
description: Maryland has returned more than $1 million in Federal funds earmarked for a nutritional program because it did not have enough help to meet Federal requirements for checking the eligibility of clients, the officials said. The money, returned to the Government over the last two years, could have provided 3,300 poor mothers and their children with $25 a month in groceries under the Special Supplemental Food Program for Women, Infants and Children.

title: AUTOMATIX INC reports earnings for qtr to July 2.
description: b-Net loss.

title: TODD SHIPYARDS CORP reports earnings for qtr to July 3.
ART'S WAY MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for qtr to May 28.
description: b-Net income.

title: Upjohn Expansion
description: Puerto Rico announced that the Upjohn Company plans to invest $40 million over the next three years to expand its pharmaceutical operation in Arecibo, following a new tax exemption agreement extending through 1998. The investment will bring to $130 million the total Upjohn spending on the complex.

title: G.M. President Sees Good 1984
description: The president of the General Motors Corporation, F. James McDonald, predicted today that 1984 would be a good year for the auto industry and said that more laid-off workers could be recalled.

title: WHITE HOUSE DROPS PLAN TO CURB DEFICIT WITH STANDBY TAXES
description: The Reagan Administration, according to several officials, has quietly dropped the President's contingency tax plan. The President had wanted it enacted this year so that new tax measures would go automatically into effect in late 1985 if they were needed to reduce the Federal deficit.

title: President's Strategy At National Education
description: H. David Bright, the president and chief operating officer of the National Education Corporation, confirmed in an interview yesterday that three weeks ago, in a telephone call to Donald Frye, the chairman of the Bell & Howell Company, he had suggested that National Education buy Bell & Howell's nonmanufacturing businesses.

title: Brazil Debt Talks Held
description: Carlos Langoni, Governor of Brazil's central bank, met yesterday in Washington with Paul A. Volcker, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, and with senior officials from the Treasury Department, the World Bank and the Inter-American Development Bank to discuss his country's debt situation.

title: WHEELING-PITTSBURGH STEEL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Net income includes a gain of $20,166,000 from the cumulative effect of an accounting change.

title: DOZENS OF KEY BURMA OFFICIALS REPORTED PURGED
description: Ne Win, the former general who has ruled Burma almost single-handedly since seizing power in 1962, has reportedly dismissed dozens of senior officials in the last two months.

title: PROTECTING HOUSE WHILE VACATIONING
description: THE burglar prowled backyards and fire escapes with his ear finely tuned to a telltale silence. Lights he saw in the homes may have twinkled on and off rhythmically each night and morning. Mail may never have piled up on the doorstep. But the burglar could tell which homes were occupied and which were empty of their vacationing residents.

title: CHESEBROUGH-POND'S INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
A BRAZILIAN COMPANY'S WOES
description: The Matarazzo group, a major Brazilian conglomerate, was started as a canned pork fat outlet 101 years ago by an Italian immigrant who persevered even after losing his first shipment of bacon sides when a ship sank at a dock here.

title: Debt Issues
description: * Avon International Finance N.V.'s

title: Bank Rates Up Again, To 8.43%
description: Interest rates for bank money market accounts rose nationwide and in the New York area in the seven days ended yesterday, The Bank Rate Monitor reported.

title: PANEL AGREES TO CUT 1983 SUPPLEMENTAL SPENDING BILL TO $7 BILLION
description: House and Senate negotiators today adopted a $7 billion supplemental spending bill for the current fiscal year after trimming it in the face of a threatened veto by President Reagan. A veto is still possible, but it is considered less likely than a few weeks ago.

title: AN AMERICAN ALIEN IN JAPAN FEELS 'LIKE A CRIMINAL'
description: In a tiny courtroom devoid of adornment, testimony has droned on for months in the trial of an American woman whose offense was to refuse to press her left index finger on an ink pad.

title: Sneva Reinstated As Race Winner
description: Tom Sneva was reinstated today as the winner of the Dana-Rex Mays 150-mile race in a decision by a three-man appeals court of Championship Auto Racing Teams.

title: Holding the Line
description: Billy Sims, the Detroit Lions' star running back, said he will play out his option this season, according to Brian Muir, a spokesman for the team. Sims has not said what his plans would be, but it is known that he rejected the Lions' $3.5 million pact for five years.

title: CORCOM INC reports earnings for qtr to July 2.
ISRAELIS TO PULL OUT OF BEIRUT AREA AND REDEPLOY TO A LINE IN SOUTH
description: The Cabinet gave unanimous approval today to plans to withdraw Israeli troops from the Beirut suburbs and the Shuf Mountains and to redeploy them on a new line in the south based on the Awali River.

title: TWO U.S. ENTRANTS DRAW RAIL FOR TROT
description: Both of the American entrants drew the rail today for the International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway on Saturday, but Yankee Predator got the better spot.

title: INCREASE IN FEES LETS CITY RETAIN CONSUMER UNITS
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Department yesterday canceled plans to close its five neighborhood offices after Mayor Koch signed a law that allows the agency to raise its license fees for a wide variety of businesses, the first such increases in 13 years.

title: HIGHER PAY CALLED KEY FOR TEACHING
description: The changes that result from the growing dissatisfaction with public education will make little difference unless they are accompanied by higher salaries to attract better teachers, according to educators and parents at a national conference that ended here today.

title: NEW OPTIONS ON HOUSEHOLD MOVES
description: MOVING is a time when one feels most vulnerable to the inequities of life, a time when Murphy's Law seems to be in full force, a time when one is dependent on the kindness, if not the tender loving care, of strangers. Anyone who has seen most of his material world crammed into cardboard cartons, where it could be walloped, smashed, crushed or crunched, knows the jittery feeling that comes with a move. And anyone who has spent a day waiting for the van that doesn't arrive knows the frustration of being dependent on movers.

title: PACWEST BANCORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: The per share figures are fully diluted.

title: CARTER ASSAILS DEMANDS ON TOKYO
description: Former President Jimmy Carter said here today that it was a ''mistake'' for the United States to make public demands on the Japanese Government in the areas of defense and trade.

title: IRAQ SAYS U.S. WEAPONS POUR INTO IRAN
description: Iraq's Foreign Minister said today that large quantities of American weapons were pouring into Iran and prolonging the 34-month-old war between the two countries.

title: 'SUPERFLIES' HELP PROTECT FORESTS BUT CREATE A FUROR IN MAINE
description: For weeks this summer, red-eyed ''superflies'' have taken over patios, lake fronts and general-store conversations in a string of western Maine logging towns. Although boosted by officials as valuable killers of destructive caterpillars in a state where commercial forests cover 90 percent of the total area, the superflies remain an accursed nuisance to outdoors-loving residents.

title: NEW CODE OF ETHICS FOR ACCOUNTANTS
description: The National Association of Accountants issued a ''Standard of Ethical Conduct for Management Accountants'' yesterday that sets guidelines of propriety for the profession.

title: No More Bounces
description: The lively red rubber ball that is essential to stickball, for many decades one of the favorite street games in New York and other urban centers, may soon become a museum piece. What generations of stickball players called ''the spaldeen'' is no longer being manufactured by Spalding Sports Worldwide of Chicopee, Mass.

title: SUPER SKY INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
USING VARNISH FOR A PROFESSIONAL LOOK
description: No one should have too much difficulty producing a smooth, even finish with today's furniture varnishes, but why settle for an ordinary result when with a special touch, a far more professional look can be achieved?

title: VULCAN MATERIALS CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
NOMINEE FOR U.S. JUDGE: JOHN FONTAINE KEENAN
description: John F. Keenan, New York City's Coordinator of Criminal Justice, is a registered Republican, but his long public service career has been largely the result of appointments by Democrats.

title: COSMOS SET BACK SOUNDERS IN SHOOTOUT
description: The Cosmos redeemed themselves after allowing two goals in the last four minutes of regulation by defeating the Seattle Sounders, 4-3, in a shootout tonight at Giants Stadium.

title: Borg-Warner Loses F.T.C. Case
description: The Federal Trade Commission has ruled that it was illegal for two members of the board of directors of the Borg-Warner Corporation to sit on the boards of a West German company and its American subsidiary, which competed in some areas with Borg-Warner.

title: Prices Advance For Eurobonds
description: Prices of bonds denominated in dollars rose in European trading today.

title: COMMONWEALTH EDISON CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
UNIMAX CORP reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $77,400. c-After a loss of $7,469,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and $7,191,200 for the 9 months, an extraordinary loss of $89,500 for the quarter, and an extraordinary credit of $574,300 for the 9 months.

title: Data General Offers Desktop Computers
description: The Data General Corporation of Westborough, Mass., entered the personal computer market yesterday, introducing a series of desktop computers aimed primarily at business users.

title: TWO OFFICIALS SAY BAN ON CONGRESS VETO POSES FEW PROBLEMS
description: Senior Administration officials reassured Congress today that last month's Supreme Court decision outlawing Congressional vetoes of executive branch actions need not produce sweeping changes in relations between the two branches of Government.

title: J.B. West, White House Aide Who Served 6 First Families
description: J. B. West, chief usher of the White House for six Presidential families, from the Franklin Roosevelts to the Nixons, died Monday at the Northern Virginia Doctors Hospital of respiratory failure. He was 70 years old.

title: Man Killed as Car Hits L.I. Tavern
description: A car being chased by the police on Route 110 here crashed into a tavern and a vacant store early today, killing a passenger and seriously injuring the driver, the police said.

title: PABST BREWING CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Net loss. Share earnings are restated for a 4-for-1 stock split effective June 14.

title: Beatles Fans Jam Studio That Served as Home
description: Hundreds of screaming Beatles fan descended Monday on Abbey Road, striding across the famous striped roadcrossing into Studio No. 2 where John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Star made music history as the Beatles.

title: Quitting, Not for Good
description: Rick Upchurch, the Denver Broncos' wide receiver who recently completed a 28-day rehabilitation program to learn ''the potential for marijuana dependency,'' said he had not sworn off the drug. ''I'm not saying I haven't or won't touch any more of it,'' he said.

title: CALIFORNIA FIRST BANK reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Operating loss c-After an extraordinary credit of $6.8 million from the exchange of capital notes for securities for the quarter and 6 months. The year-ago per share figures adjusted for 5 percent stock dividend paid in April.

title: SYBIL L. GOLDEN
description: Sybil L. Golden, a leader in civic and educational affairs and a writer on nature and environmental issues, died Tuesday at her country home in Olivebridge, N.Y., after a long illness. She was 65 years old and also lived in Manhattan.

title: CUOMO SIGNS BILL TO SPUR BUILDING OF RENTAL UNITS
description: Governor Cuomo today signed legislation intended to provide millions of dollars in low-interest mortgages for the construction of private rental housing around the state.

title: Garden State Park Begins Rebuilding
description: The rebuilding of Garden State Park began today with a groundbreaking ceremony.

title: DUCOMMUN INC reports earnings for qtr to July 1.
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $552,000 for the quarter and $872,000 for the 6 months. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $266,000 for the quarter and $77,000 for the 6 months.

title: PUGET SOUND BANCORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
INTERGRAPH CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Share earnings have been adjusted for a 2-for-1 stock split paid in February.

title: PROGRAMMING & SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
ETHYL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid April 11.

title: MACMILLAN INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes pre-tax gains from the sale of real estate of $3,206,000 for the quarter and 6 months, pre-tax gains from the disposition of securities of $448,000 for the quarter and $1,195,000 for the 6 months, pre-tax foreign exchange losses of $894,000 for the quarter and $1,853,000 for the 6 months, and a pre-tax gain from the repurchase of debentures of $161,000 for the 6 months. c-Includes gains from discontinued operations of $123,000 for the quarter and $385,000 for the 6 months, pre-tax gains from the repurchase of bentures of $188,000 for the quarter and $1,648,000 for the 6 months, pre-tax foreign exchange losses of $254,000 for the quarter and $452,000 for the 6 months, and a pre-tax gain of $4,507,000 from the sale of real estate for the 6 months.

title: WALTER BERRY'S TIME TO WAIT
description: W alter Berry is spending his summer playing basketball, and working in a security job at St. John's University, and waiting. He is waiting to see if he will be allowed to play basketball in a St. John's uniform next season. Most of all, he is waiting for all the questions, and his role as the object of a growing controversy, to end.

title: ILLEGAL ALIENS: BAD TACK
description: In an effort to do something about the large number of illegal immigrants entering the United States in search of work, Congress is on the verge of passing fundamentally flawed legislation that will only make matters worse.

title: EXCERPTS FROM THE STATEMENT BY VOLCKER ON ECONOMIC POLICY
description: Following are excerpts from a statement today by Paul A. Volcker, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, before the House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs: Introduction

title: Delaware Ties Probation To Victim Notification
description: Crime victims in Delaware must now be warned by the state if their attackers are released to a custody program.

title: AMERICAN FLETCHER CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Supertruck
description: P arked on Fifth Avenue, opposite Bergdorf's and the Plaza Hotel, it looked outre - ''Bigfoot,'' an off-road vehicle suited up with a ton of bulbous, tires four and a half feet high.

title: Wisconsin Tries to Block Change in Radio System
description: State officials asked a Federal court today to order work stopped on a Navy communications antenna system designed to send signals to submerged submarines in wartime.

title: Key Rates
description: *Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: Missiles Protested in Sicily
description: About 350 demonstrators protesting plans to locate United States cruise missiles in Italy blocked the gates today to an airfield where the missiles are to be housed, a spokesman for the protesters said. He said the 11-hour blockade was peaceful.

title: VICON INDUSTRIES reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Share earnings do not reflect a 3-for- 2 stock split paid July 1.

title: VICTORY MARKETS INC reports earnings for qtr to July 2.
LA MAUR INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Share earnings have been adjusted to reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid in May 1983.

title: Match the 13 Cabinet departments and their deputies:
description: Department No. 2 1. State A. Vacant 2. Treasury B. Gary L. Jones 3.

title: ISRAEL SAID TO AID LATIN AIMS OF U.S.
description: Israel, at the request of the United States, is sending weapons captured from the Palestine Liberation Organization to Honduras for eventual use by Nicaraguan rebels, according to senior Reagan Administration officials.

title: CONCERT: MOSTLY MOZART
description: IF Mostly Mozart Festival's repertory trend continues in the direction it is now headed, the Mostly Mozart name will soon be about as descriptive as Madison Square Garden's.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Alleghany Corp. said that its board had approved in principle the previously announced sale of substantially all of Alleghany's assets to the American Express Co. in exchange for 15.25 million American Express shares.

title: CITY FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $854,000 for the quarter and 6 months from penalties on prepayment of Federal Home Loan Bank advances.

title: NBC MOVES PAST ABC IN PRIME-TIME TV RATINGS
description: Fueled by the increased popularity of more than a half-dozen weekly series, NBC - customarily last in the three network ratings race - has held second place in prime-time popularity the last 13 weeks behind CBS.

title: PERSONAL INCOME UP 0.5% IN JUNE
description: The Government said today that personal income rose five-tenths of 1 percent last month, reflecting an improved employment picture.

title: DISQUIET IN DENMARK IS JUST UNDER THE VENEER
description: Like other European capitals filled with tourists this summer, Copenhagen has a sheen of plenty. Swedes, Germans, Americans and others move in a serpentine mass along pedestrian shopping streets past gleaming shop windows filled with expensive goods and delicacies.

title: Northwest Down 97.7% in 2d Quarter
description: Northwest Industries, citing continuing losses at its Lone Star Steel subsidiary, reported yesterday that earnings in the second quarter plunged 97.7 percent, while sales declined 25.3 percent.

title: NEW YORK STATE ELECTRIC & GAS CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
TO KEEP ROADS UP AND BRIDGES FROM FALLING DOWN
description: To the Editor:

title: Andropov Is Too Busy To Meet Maine Girl
description: The American schoolgirl Samantha Smith will not meet Yuri A. Andropov, but will go home Thursday with presents from him to remind her of her stay in the Soviet Union, her father said today.

title: CARLISLE CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
POLAROID CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After a pre-tax charge of $28,700,000 from writeoffs of excess assembly capacity.

title: NICARAGUA'S CALL FOR PEACE EFFORT WELCOMED BY U.S.
description: The Reagan Administration said today that it regarded the peace proposal put forward by Nicaragua on Tuesday as ''a positive step'' and hoped it would be discussed in detail with other ideas at a meeting in Panama next week of nine Central and South American nations.

title: Market Place; Price Swings in Dart Drug
description: LAST Friday, shares of the Dart Drug Corporation, a little-known but stellar performer in the current bull market, plunged 26 points, to 117 bid, in over-the-counter trading. Within the last 52 weeks, Dart's stock had soared more than tenfold - from a low of 14 1/2 to a record of 148.

title: CONCERT: FESTIVAL IN VILLAGE
description: IT rained for a spell Tuesday night, so the Washington Square Music Festival's first concert of the season was held in New York University's Loeb Student Center, a few hundred feet south of the park for which the festival is named. Newell Jenkins led the orchestra in music by Joseph Martin Kraus, Alessandro Rolla, Haydn and Mozart.

title: Brazil's Industrial Center Faces Strike Shutdown
description: Sao Paulo, the largest industrial center in South America, faced a virtual shutdown today after transport workers voted to back a 24-hour strike called by other unions to protest the military Government's economic policies.

title: SOUTHWEST FLORIDA BANKS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Oil Spending Off China
description: Capital spending on projects related to oil off China could reach $75 billion over the next 10 years if major exploration successes are forthcoming, the brokerage of De Zoete & Bevan said in a study. Oil companies are currently bidding for acreage in the Pearl River basin, south of Hong Kong, where potential reservoirs are put at 20 billion to 40 billion barrels of recoverable oil, the De Zoete study said. The Yellow Sea, where blocks are also being offered, appears less promising, it added.

title: WESTERN UNION TELEGRAPH CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes extraordinary gains of $112,000, or 1 cent a share, for the quarter and $213,000,000, or 1 cent a share, for the 6 months, and a gain of $5,600,000, or 27 cents a share, for the quarter from a refund of past payments to American Telephone & Telegraph and the Bell System Companies for leased communications facilities.

title: Spanish Banker Gains A Listing on Big Board
description: Alfonso Escamez, chairman of Spain's largest bank holding company, maintains that he ''had great faith in the American economy even two years ago when it was in a recession.'' In an interview yesterday, he added readily that his ''faith has been more than confirmed.''

title: Ex-Patient Sought in Killings
description: The police began a nationwide search today for a former mental patient related to five slaying victims. Detectives said they wanted to talk to Michael O. Perry, 28 years old, in the shooting deaths of his father and mother and three other relatives.

title: RLC CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes income from spunoff operations of $897,000 for the quarter and $2,551,000 for the 9 months.

title: Manhattanite Wins $4 Million in Lotto
description: A 34-year-old woman from Manhattan won $4,074,000 in the latest Lotto drawing. The woman, Tuenchi Potiticka, who came from Thailand 10 years ago, said she stayed calm when she learned that her numbers - 2, 7, 16, 17, 36 and 37 - were chosen Saturday night.

title: CENTRAL HUDSON GAS & ELECTRIC CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Government Bars Marketing Of Untested 'Sobriety' Drugs
description: Unt@ested ''sobriety'' pills or potions cannot be legally sold to motorists who want to drink and drive, the Food and Drug Administration has announced.

title: FRANK REYNOLDS, ABC NEWSMAN, DIES
description: Frank Reynolds, the ABC News anchorman since 1978, died yesterday in Washington. He was 59 years old. Mr. Reynolds had been ill with multiple myeloma, a form of bone cancer, for several months, but his death was attributed to acute viral hepatitis. He had been absent from his anchor slot on ABC's ''World News Tonight'' since April and, since then, the program dropped in the ratings to third place behind ''NBC Nightly News'' and ''CBS Evening News.''

title: People
description: * Robert W. Cooney has been named vice president of marketing for the Bethlehem Steel Corporation's steel group.

title: Ryder Truck Account Is Going to Thompson
description: J. Walter Thompson U.S.A. has won the Ryder Truck Rental account.

title: THOUSAND TRAILS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CONTINENTAL GROUP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
No Headline
description: Transactions AUTO RACING Tom Sneva was reinstated as winner of D ana-Rex Mays 150 race after appealing d isqualification for failing to pass routine t echnical inspection. BASEBALL CALIFORNIA (AL) - Placed Doug De- C inces, third baseman, on 15-day disabled l ist retroactive to July 14; released Bill T ravers, pitcher, and recalled Ricky S teirer, pitcher, from Edmonton of Pa- c ific Coast League. BALTIMORE (AL) - Reactivated Dan F ord, outfielder, and optioned Mike Y oung, outfielder, to Rochester of Interna- t ional League. MILWAUKEE (AL) - Signed Moose H aas, right-handed pitcher, to multiyear c ontract. PITTSBURGH (NL) - Recalled Jose D eLeon, right-handed pitcher, from Ha- w aii team in Pacific Coast League.

title: STANLEY WORKS reports earnings for qtr to July 3.
Diamond Crystal
description: The Diamond Crystal Salt Company has agreed to a $32 million out-of-court settlement offered by Texaco Inc. and the Wilson Brothers Corporation stemming from a suit filed in 1980. The suit was filed after an oil rig operated for Texaco by Wilson Brothers broke through the roof of a Diamond Crystal salt mine in Louisiana. Diamond Crystal, based in St. Clair, Mich., said it would repay its insurance carriers $3.5 million of $10 million it previously received from them in settlement in insurance claims.

title: PLIGHT OF BEING NO. 2: IMPORTANT BUT UNRECOGNIZED
description: Last May, when Treasury Secretary Donald T. Regan announced plans to travel to Brazil, Peru and Mexico, reporters from a dozen publications immediately booked seats on his plane.

title: BANKAMERICA ROSE 15.3% IN 2D QUARTER
description: The BankAmerica Corporation reported yesterday that net income rose 15.3 percent in the second quarter, to $141.9 million, from $123.1 million in the comparable period a year earlier.

title: SCHWAB SAFE CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: The results for 1983 include the operations of the Modern Mill Corp. from April 1.

title: 'Buy New York' Means New York Pays
description: Governor Cuomo is not pleased. Just days after he signed New York's ''Buy American steel'' law, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority signed a contract to buy 15,000 tons of Japanese and Korean steel for bridge repairs.

title: SCHIZOID LATIN POLICY
description: Time is running out in Central America. President Reagan should lead us away from the brink of a regional war that threatens an explosion of bloodshed. Instead of creating an American war, he should seek a Latin peace.

title: O'BRIEN SIGNS WITH JETS FOR $1.7 MIILION
description: Ken O'Brien disappointed his friends who wanted to play touch football yesterday. Instead, the 22-year-old quarterback agreed to a contract that made him the highest-paid rookie in Jets' history: a 4-year package worth about $1.7 million.

title: New Encore Coup: A Digital Executive
description: The Encore Computer Corporation, a new venture founded by the former chief executive officer of the Prime Computer Corporation, entered the hotly competitive market with a splash last week when it lured six marketing executives away from Prime. Yesterday, in what analysts said was a major coup for the fledgling company, Encore secured its scientific talent: C. Gordon Bell, the vice president for engineering at the Digital Equipment Corporation.

title: DIANA ROSS PRESENTING CONCERT IN PARK TONIGHT
description: ''I've never done a free concert on this scale before,'' Diana Ross said the other day, during a break from preparations for her appearance on the Great Lawn of Central Park tonight at 6 o'clock. ''But I've been touring, and I see what's going on in this country. I see that a lot of kids just don't have the money to get into concerts. Besides, this city has given me a gift, and I'd like to give something back.''

title: Q & A
description: Q. I have some teak furniture that has grown dark over the years. I have never used polish on this furniture. Can you tell me how to clean and lighten it?

title: NOSTALGIA FOR SALE AT A HOUSTON HOTEL
description: Hundreds of people lined up today for a chance to buy furnishings from the Lamar Hotel, once home to the wealthy and powerful.

title: 16 SIBERIAN PENTECOSTALS END A TRIP TO FREEDOM
description: With the summer heat bearing down, 16 Siberian Pentecostals spent their first day in St. Louis resting from their long journey to freedom. They had been trying to emigrate from the Soviet Union since the early 1960's, fleeing from religious oppression the Pentecostals say they have suffered there.

title: A.T.& T.'S NET INCOME RISES 10.5%
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company yesterday reported a 10.5 percent increase in its second-quarter earnings and announced a further cutback of operations at the Western Electric Company, its manufacturing arm.

title: TALKS ON STATE INQUIRY PANEL RESUME
description: Aides to Governor Cuomo and Warren M. Anderson, the majority leader of the State Senate, resumed negotiations last night in an effort to end the confrontation set off when Mr. Cuomo ousted a Republican from the State Commission of Investigation.

title: Yankees Win Sixth Straight
description: Ron Davis knows the consequences of power. The former Yankee relief pitcher was traded from New York in the first week last season for Roy Smalley's defense and bat strength. Davis was victimized by power again yesterday, this time serving up a two-run homer to Don Baylor in the 10th inning that led the Yankees to a 6-4 victory over the Minnesota Twins before a crowd of 27,583 at Yankee Stadium.

title: ABC Up 8.9% In 2d Quarter
description: The American Broadcasting Companies reported yesterday the best single quarter in its history, with contributions coming from television, radio and publishing, but not from cable.

title: HERS
description: IWISH I had a nice safe job like Sally Ride -it's too risky down here in television. Astronauts only have to worry about the weather; producers live and die by the ratings. Fred Silverman's law of physics says: a hit can drop faster than a bomb. When it does you're back home faster than Dorothy and Toto. Out of work - again.

title: WASHINGTON WATER POWER CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
NORTHWEST INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
BANKAMERICA CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After a gain from the cumulative effect of an accounting change of $31 million.

title: Gillespie and Eckstine Will Salute Earl Hines
description: Dizzy Gillespie and Billy Eckstine will give a gala salute to the late pianist Earl (Fatha) Hines on Sept. 18 at 7:30 p.m. at the National Museum of Natural History, Constitution Avenue and 10th Street, N.W.

title: BTR Has 93% of Tilling
description: BTR P.L.C. said today that it holds more than 93 percent of the ordinary shares of Thomas Tilling P.L.C. and plans to acquire the rest. BTR has been offering 11 of its new ordinary shares for every 20 Tilling shares.

title: BRUSH WELLMAN INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $212,000 for the quarter and $366,000 for the 6 months.

title: DETECTION SYSTEMS reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Including a tax credit of $108,000. c-Net income.

title: 2 MUSEUMS TO ADD BALANCE TO SOHO
description: WITH the pending arrival of not one but two contemporary museums in its midst, SoHo is ripening as the center for nonprofit activity in contemporary art, a development that balances nicely its bustling commercial side. On Sept. 23, the New Museum of Contemporary Art, founded in 1976 by Marcia Tucker, will move from its outgrown 14th Street quarters to 583 Broadway, between Houston and Prince Streets, and early in 1985 Edward R. Broida, a new but very determined collector from California, will open his own museum just four blocks away in a four-story building at 130 Prince Street.

title: REICHHOLD CHEMICALS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After a charge of $900,000 for the abandonment of a facility in 1982. Year-ago sales figures are restated for an accounting change. Year-ago quarter results include foreign exchange gains of 6 cents a share. Results for the 6 months include foreign exchange gains of 2 cents a share for the latest 6 months compared to 13 cents a share for the year-ago 6 months.

title: Soviet Setback on Trade
description: The Soviet Union has failed in the first stage of an appeal to the European Court of Justice over a Common Market antidumping order, officials said today. Razno Import, the Soviet nickel exporter, asked the community's court to suspend a 7 percent duty imposed on exports of unworked nickel until the court rules on a Soviet request that the duty be lifted. The court declined to suspend the duty, which was imposed last month after a ruling that Razno was unfairly undercutting the nickel prices of community producers.

title: STOCKS IN BEST GAIN IN NEARLY 8 MONTHS
description: The credit markets snapped out of the doldrums yesterday and interest rates declined sharply in early trading on hopes that the Federal Reserve Board's revised growth targets for the nation's basic money supply will allow short-term rates to remain stable or even decline slightly.

title: REVCO DRUG STORES INC reports earnings for qtr to May 28.
description: Share earnings are adjusted to reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid April 1983.

title: THE MANY AND VARIED GOOD USES OF HYPNOSIS
description: To the Editor:

title: Duty Free Said To Fill Post
description: Adrian Bellamy, described in the New York retail trade as ''the finest merchant in South Africa,'' will shortly be named president of the Duty Free Shops of Honolulu, the retailer that operates duty-free shops around the world, according to reliable sources.

title: Park Renamed to Honor Vietnam Veterans
description: A brick-paved park in the financial district was dedicated yesterday as the city's Vietnam Veterans Memorial, while helicopters whirred in the background, landing and taking off from the Downtown Heliport.

title: PARIS SAYS SUSPECT CONFESSES ATTACK
description: The French Government said today that a 29-yearold Syrian national of Armenian extraction had confessed to planting the bomb at Orly Airport that killed six people and wounded 56 others on Friday.

title: LOW-BUDGET SPACES WITH HIGH-BUDGET DRAMATICS
description: THE white wall lamps that cast a soft light in James Wollens's East Village loft have a simple, elegant design reminiscent of Art Deco. But if you look closely, you realize each lamp is actually a stack of four paper plates constructed with wood dowels and held up by a thin thread attached to the wall. Mr. Wollens, an architect, estimates the cost of materials for the lamp shade at 67 cents.

title: ADAC LABORATORIES reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
VALLEN CORP reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
MARSH SUPERMARKETS reports earnings for qtr to June 25.
SAN JOSE WATER WORKS reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
AMERICAN BROADCASTING COMPANIES INC (ABC) reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
HOUSE ROLL-CALL VOTE ON MOVE TO DELETE MX FUNDS
description: Following is the roll-call vote of 220 to 207 by which the House of Representatives today rejected efforts to cut out production money for the MX missile. A ''yes'' vote is a vote to cut out the money. A ''no'' vote is a vote to retain the money. Voting ''yes'' were 189 Democrats and 18 Republicans. Voting ''no'' were 73 Democrats and 147 Republicans. An ''xxx'' denotes those not voting. There is one vacancy in the 435-member House. ALABAMA Democrats - Bevill, no; Erdreich, no; Flippo, no; Nichols, no; Shelby, no. Republicans - Dickinson, no; Edwards, no.

title: BARNES GROUP INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
ANCHOR HOCKING CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $2,671,000 for the quarter and $3,206,000 for the 6 months. c-After a loss from discontinued operations of $391,000 and a provision for disposal of discontinued operations of $29.9 million.

title: John Davidson Retires
description: John Davidson, the Rangers' goaltender who has been plagued with injuries, has decided to give his body a break before it's too late.

title: DUN & BRADSTREET INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Share earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split effective May 20.

title: HOLIDAY INNS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $2.7 million for the quarter and $6.5 million for the 6 months.

title: PAMOUR PORCUPINE MINES LTD reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes a special gain of $670,000 from the sale of investments in the first quarter, the company said. c-Net loss.

title: At Least 5 Die in Crash Near Cleveland Airport
description: At least five people were killed today when a twin-engine plane crashed in a parking lot about a mile east of Cleveland's Hopkins International Airport, the authorities said.

title: PROJECTED U.S. MANEUVERS TO CENTER ON HONDURAS
description: The Reagan Administration is considering plans to send Army engineers and Air Force transports to Honduras, aircraft carriers along the two coasts of Central America and the battleship New Jersey through the Panama Canal as part of the projected military exercises in the area. according to senior officials.

title: THE BODY IN DANIEL BOONE'S GRAVE MAY NOT BE HIS
description: Who's buried in Daniel Boone's grave? Chances are it's not Boone, says an anthropologist who looks at old bones for a living.

title: Title Bouts Scheduled
description: Aaron Pryor and Thomas Hearns will defend their boxing titles in Las Vegas on Sept. 9. Pryor, the World Boxing Association junior welterweight champion, will face Alexis Arguello, and Hearns, the World Boxing Council's super welterweight champion, will meet James Green.

title: The U.N. Today; July 21,1983; GENERAL ASSEMBLY
description: States Parties to the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights - 10:30 A.M.

title: WHITEHALL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
CALENDAR OF EVENTS: A CARPENTRY COURSE
description: Apartment Carpentry, West Side Y.M.C.A., 5 West 63d Street, 212-787- 4400.

title: Massey-Ferguson
description: Massey-Ferguson Ltd. of Toronto said it had arranged a $200 million, three-year revolving loan agreement for its finance subsidiary through the Continental Bank of Canada. The money is to be used by customers who buy its farm machinery.

title: DORSEY CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Net loss.

title: COMPREHENSIVE CARE CORP reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $231,000.

title: U S BANCORP (PORTLAND, ORE) reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
HOME IMPROVEMENT
description: THE purchase of a house is the largest investment most people make, and it is well worth taking care of that investment to keep it from ''growing old'' before its time and losing a good part of its value.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In some editions yesterday, a bio- graphical sketch of Nicholas F. Brady, a member of the Presidential commission on Central America, in- correctly described his relationship with Dillon, Read & Company. He is chairman and managing director.

title: SUIT CHALLENGES SCARSDALE CRECHE BAN
description: A group of Scarsdale, N.Y., residents, citing the constitutional rights of free speech and free exercise of religion, went to Federal District Court in Manhattan yesterday to seek to reverse a Village Board decision that has barred the display of a Nativity scene in Boniface Circle, a public park.

title: ZENITH NATIONAL INSURANCE CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Winds Knock Out Power To Minnesota Homes
description: Tens of thousands of homes were blacked out today after thunderstorms tore through Minnesota with 115-milean-hour winds, blowing away airport hangars, flattening cottages and uprooting trees, the authorities said.

title: TWP AIDES TO FLY ON COSTLY U.S JET
description: Defense Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger and other senior officials in the Reagan Administration plan to travel to California later this week on Government and personal business in an Air Force transport that costs $2,300 an hour to fly.

title: CONRAIL (CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORP) reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Including income from sale of tax credits of $3,445,000 for the quarter and $11,756,000 for the 6 months. c-Including income from sale of tax credits of $27,563,000 for the quarter and $34,876,000 for the 6 months.

title: News Analysis
description: The disclosure by the Bank for International Settlements that new loans from Western banks to the third world virtually dried up in the first three months of this year opens bankers to the renewed charge that they are sacrificing the health of the world economy to protect their own interests.

title: BARON DATA SYSTEMS reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Frederick B. Artz Dies at 88; Oberlin Historian and Author
description: Prof. Frederick B. Artz, a French and medieval historian at Oberlin College, died of a stroke yesterday in Oberlin, Ohio. He was 88 years old.

title: Kaat's New Sport
description: After pitching for 25 years in the major leagues, more than any other hurler in history, Jim Kaat expects to spend the rest of the summer at his home in Glen Mills, Pa. He was released two weeks ago by the St. Louis Cardinals and cleared waivers this week.

title: CITYTRUST BANCORP INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
COLUMBIA GENERAL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
STERLING DRUG INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
NATIONAL CITY BANCORPORATION reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
KOCH PREPARED INTENSELY FOR THE HEARING ON POLICE
description: The speech that Mayor Koch had prepared for the Congressional hearing on allegations of police brutality against blacks was the result of nearly a dozen meetings that he held with top city officials, including one at which black aides were asked to give their opinions, City Hall officials said yesterday.

title: REGULATORS SET PLAN FOR BALDWIN
description: Arkansas insurance regulators, seeking to stem losses at the Baldwin-United Corporation, have proposed that holders of the company's annuities be paid a lower interest rate and temporarily prohibited from cashing in their policies.

title: TEACHER PAY PARADOX
description: To the Editor:

title: FIRST INTERSTATE BANCORPORATION reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
REAGAN OFFER ON PAPERS IS MADE BUT REJECTED IN CAMPAIGN INQUIRY
description: White House officials today made a formal proposal to a House subcommittee investigating the conduct of the 1980 Presidential campaign that wants access to President Reagan's campaign materials.

title: News Summary; THURSDAY, JULY 21, 1983
description: International Nicaragua's peace plan was greeted by the Reagan Administration as a ''positive step.'' The Administration expressed hope that the proposals would be discussed in detail along with other proposals at a meeting in Panama next week of nine Latin American countries. Among the proposals made by Nicaragua Tuesday was for regional talks on ways of easing military tensions and a halt in military support for insurgencies. (Page A1, Column 1.) Honduras is receiving P.L.O. arms seized by Israeli forces that have been requested by Washington for eventual use by Nicaraguan insurgents, according to senior Administration officials. The Israelis have previously been an independent supplier of arms in Central America. (A1:2.)

title: Pope to Visit Canada
description: Pope John Paul II plans to visit Canada for three days in September 1984, the Winnipeg Archdiocese announced. He will visit Winnipeg, Edmonton and Vancouver.

title: U.S. RECERTIFYING GAINS IN SALVADOR
description: Secretary of State George P. Shultz said today that El Salvador's human rights record met the legal requirements for continued foreign aid, but that its record ''falls short of the broad and sustained progress'' sought by Congress and the Reagan Administration.

title: NORTHERN TELECOM LTD reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes special gains of $8,600,000 for the quarter and $16,200,000 for the 6 months. c-Restated to reflect an accounting change. Share earnings reflect a 3-for-1 stock split in May 1983.

title: SUMMER PEACE: A MOTHER'S PHILOSOPHY
description: THIS year, in a rare alignment of the planets, each child in this family graduated from a different school. I spent the better (and more uplifting) part of June wrapping presents and bursting into tears at the unfamiliar sight of a child in white ducks, combed hair and a docile expression on his face. For a parent, graduation ceremonies are one of life's most pleasant cultural experiences; for one brief moment everything is in control.

title: ONYX-IMI INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Includes share in loss of a joint venture of $62,851 for the quarter and $249,966 for the 9 months.

title: CONSOLIDATED FREIGHTWAYS INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
RALSTON PURINA CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $600,000 for the quarter and $1,600,000 for the 9 months.

title: Burroughs Computer
description: The Burroughs Corporation said today that it had reduced maintenance charges by 42 percent for its B20 computer system used by small businesses.

title: British Telecom Off
description: British Telecom, the state-owned corporation that operates Britain's telephone and telecommunications system, announced today that net profits for the year ending March 31 fell 20 percent, to about $555.3 million, from about $696.8 million the previous year. The drop was largely due to increased depreciation charges.

title: PACCAR INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
D'AMATO AND LILCO CHIEF CONFER ON RATE INCREASES
description: Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato met here today with the chairman of the Long Island Lighting Company and aides of state and local officials to explore ways of reducing the utility's proposed electric rate increases.

title: College Costs Up 9-10% a Year
description: It will cost students $4,618 a year to attend a typical public college this fall and $8,939 to attend a private college, the American Council on Education forecast today.

title: MIDCON CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
EX-GOV. BROWN STAYS ACTIVE IN TWO GROUPS AND IN POLITICS
description: Edmund G. Brown Jr., who dominated California politics for eight years, is traveling, writing and, uncharacteristically, avoiding the press these days. But friends say he has not abandoned hope of public office.

title: STOCKS IN BEST GAIN IN NEARLY 8 MONTHS
description: The stock market scored its biggest one-day gain in nearly eight months yesterday as jitters over rising interest rates faded in response to Congressional testimony by Paul A. Volcker, the Federal Reserve chairman.

title: 3 KILLED IN SHELLING OF CHRISTIAN AREA OF BEIRUT
description: Three artillery shells struck a Christian quarter of this capital today, killing 3 people and wounding 20, and the Lebanese Christian Phalangist Party said Syrian forces were to blame.

title: TWO WOMEN ON LIST FOR TOP STATE COURT
description: Seven candidates, including two women, were recommended yesterday for a seat on the New York Court of Appeals, the state's highest court.

title: ROLLINS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Wheeling Steel Reports Loss
description: The Wheeling-Pittsburgh Steel Corporation, the nation's eighth-largest steelmaker, today reported a loss of $18.9 million for the second quarter.

title: KIMBERLY-CLARK CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Results for the year-ago quarter and 6 months include a gain of $13.9 million from the exchange of stock for debt.

title: JOE BEGGS
description: Joe Beggs, who pitched for the New York Yankees and the New York Giants but spent most of his nine-year major league career with the Cincinnati Reds, died of a heart attack Tuesday.

title: SHEIK'S COUP IN SPORT OF KINGS
description: What made a yearling thoroughbred colt by Northern Dancer worth the record price of $10.2 million he fetched in the Keeneland sales ring Tuesday night? According to breeding and sales experts interviewed yesterday, it was less the appeal of the colt's pedigree or conformation than the culmination of an ongoing bidding war between the two most powerful stables in Europe.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES;
description: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation and Ticor Investment Securities yesterday announced a special program in which 181 different mortgage lenders in 38 states may originate up to $1.42 billion of home mortgages during the next year.

title: Yugoslavia Aid Package
description: A group of about 600 Western banks is near agreement on a $4.5 billion financial package aimed at shoring up Yugoslavia's ailing economy, a key figure in the talks said today.

title: VICTIMS OF DEREGULATION
description: To the Editor:

title: NICOLET INSTRUMENT CORP reports earnings for qtr to July 1.
description: b-Net loss.

title: HEXCEL CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
LOCKHEED CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
13 Hurt in IRT Fire At Harlem Station
description: Thirteen people were injured yesterday by an electrical fire under an unoccupied subway train at the 125th Street station on the East Side IRT in Harlem. The fire delayed 20,000 riders and caused extensive backups on the line from 125th Street to Grand Central, the Transit Authority said.

title: Frenchmen Lead In Tour de France
description: Jacques Michaud of France today won the 18th of the 22 stages in the Tour de France bicycle race, a 153-mile struggle through 5 Alpine passes.

title: JUSTIN INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: b-Net loss.

title: MURRAY OHIO MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
Centuries and Joy Mingle In Bryant Park
description: K naves, varlets, wenches, a king and queen, courtiers, milkmaids, a goatherd (herding one goat), magicians, a bishop and a hangman streamed across 42d Street yesterday as traffic screeched to a halt. Court musicians heralded their arrival in Bryant Park with a rousing trumpet voluntary out of the 18th century by Jeremiah Clarke.

title: Official Leaves City Business Unit
description: New York City's Commissioner of International Business Development, Herbert Salzman, resigned yesterday after 126 days in the post. In a letter to Deputy Mayor Kenneth Lipper, Mr. Salzman said he had completed his mission. Mr. Salzman, a 67-year-old retired investment executive, was appointed last Feb. 7 and took office March 15.

title: Phibro-Salomon Up
description: Phibro-Salomon Inc., the securities and commodities firm, reported an 88.5 percent jump in net earnings for the second quarter to $115 million, or 82 cents a share, from $61 million, or 45 cents a share in the period a year ago. Revenues from its activities totaled $7.9 billion, or a 31.7 percent increase above the $6 billion reported in the same period last year.

title: SAGA CORP reports earnings for qtr to June 25.
URANIUM SPILL STILL WORRIES NAVAJOS
description: Four years after an accident sent uranium waste rushing down the Rio Puerco, Navajos say they are still unable to return to normal lives based on farming and herding.

title: NOVA FUND INC reports earnings for As of June 30.
description: Asset figures represent net assets.

title: HILLER AVIATION reports earnings for qtr to May 31.
Space Agency Enters The Stamp Business
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration, which drummed three men out of the astronaut corps for smuggling postal stamps to the moon, is going into the stamp-selling business itself on the mission of the space shuttle Challenger next month.

title:
HELPFUL HARDWARE;
OUTDOOR CONVENIENCE
description: IF your patio becomes your living room in the summertime, some simple additions can make outdoor living much more convenient. Twin Tech produces three chair organizers - a small pocket, a large pocket and a folding food tray - that clamp on the side of a lawn chair.

title: It All Began With Artichokes
description: I n the beginning, an artichoke was its symbol. Now it has almost become an artifact. Saturday night, Roosevelt Raceway will put on its 25th International Trot, won in 1959 by Jamin, a French horse with a passion for artichokes. In its early years, the International attracted more than 50,000 parishioners on each of four occasions, about 8,000 more than any other American harness race has ever drawn. But those big crowds gathered in the years before OTB and state lotteries, before the Meadowlands track was built, before Atlantic City had casinos. Before people had other places to blow their paychecks, legally.

title: New Offerings Set Mark in First Half
description: Corporations raised a record $58.7 billion through the sale of securities in the first half of 1983, more than double the amount raised in the corresponding period of 1982, according to a compilation by Abrahamsen & Company, a statistical research firm.

title: He's Pitching Like His Idol
description: An autographed baseball, with Whitey Ford's signature, holds a prominent spot atop Shane Rawley's locker at Yankee Stadium. Rawley, New York's 27-year-old left-hander, asked the former Yankee great for the memento during the old-timers game at the Stadium last Saturday.

title: SCIENTISTS GIVE E.P.A. CHIEF VARYING VIEWS ON ACID RAIN PROBLEM
description: Saying he needed enlightenment to develop an acid rain policy, William D. Ruckelshaus, Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, listened today while a panel of 15 scientists exchanged facts, figures, opinions and assertions.

title: Liberty Captures 3 From Courageous
description: Liberty defeated Courageous in all three races sailed today on hazy Rhode Island Sound. As a result, midway through the United States trials to select the America's Cup defender. it appears that Liberty has an edge over its two rivals.

title: Looking for Fans
description: The Continental Basketball Association, the nation's top minor league with 12 teams ranging from Brockton, Mass., in the East to Albuquerque, N.M., in the West, is not satisfied with the total attendance of 330,920 for 264 games last season

title: PHIBRO-SALOMON INC reports earnings for qtr to June 30.
description: Year-ago results have been restated for a 2-for-1 stock split in 1983.

title: VEGETABLES HAVE FLOWERS, TOO
description: VEGETABLE gardeners are often so busy looking for the fruits of their labors that they don't take time out to see the flowers. Yet some of them are quite lovely and worth more than a passing glance.

title: LITTLE PRINCE PRODUCTIONS reports earnings for year to March 31.
14 INTELLECTUALS GET AWARDS OF UP TO $300,000
description: Fourteen ''exceptionally talented individuals'' were named yesterday by the John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation of Chicago to receive awards ranging from $24,000 to $60,000 annually for five years.

description: The per share figures are fully diluted.

description: See accompanying notes for special items. (Loss) * Loss in year-earlier period.

Books Of The Times
description: By Christopher Lehmann-Haupt AUGUST. By Judith Rossner. 376 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $15.95.

title: Revlon Hires TV Star To Promote a Perfume
description: In the minds of Revlon top brass, the role of Alexis Carrington played in the TV series ''Dynasty'' by Joan Collins is that of a scoundrel.

THURSDAY, JULY 21, 1983; Markets
description: Paul A. Volcker said the Federal Reserve has decided to raise the growth targets for the basic money supply for the rest of 1983. Some analysts said the move could ease upward pressure on interest rates. But in his House testimony, Mr. Volcker insisted that the Fed will not permit a continuation of the rapid monetary growth of the first half of 1983. The Fed's main goals, he said, include containing inflation as well as assuring economic growth. (Page A1.)

title: A Peace Scare From Managua
description: What is a reasonable bargain that could promote stability and perhaps even peace in Central America? Here is one idea: Call off the dogs of war, insist on absolutely no military intervention across any border, ban the shipment of offensive weapons to all governments in the region, buy one-way tickets home for all foreign military advisers, reward respect for human rights and democratic elections and encourage true reconciliation all around.

description: Helen Hayes's name returned to Broadway yesterday when the Little Theater on West 44th Street was renamed in her honor. It was the second time Miss Hayes has been honored with the naming of a Broadway theater. But the other Helen Hayes Theater was torn down in the spring of 1982, after impassioned demonstrations to save it, to make way for the Marriott Marquis hotel now going up near Times Square.

The previous high of 153.7 million shares was set on May 13. The short interest for the period a year earlier totaled 95.6 million shares.

title: THEATER: EARLY CHEKHOV AT WILLIAMSTOWN, MASS.
description: As directors like Andrei Serban and Peter Brook have made clear, there's no reason to perform Chekhov under a shroud. But is there any case for staging the writer's first produced play, ''Ivanov,'' as slapstick farce? Judging from John Madden's production at the Williamstown Theater Festival, I'd say the answer is an emphatic no. If an audience is giggling as the protagonist picks up a gun to blow his brains out, you can be sure that the gag has been taken too far.

title: NEW POOR IN BRAZIL TURN PEDDLING INTO PROFESSION
